solution.text:
No. of cards in a deck of playing cards \(=52\)
No. of spades in a deck of playing cards \(=13\)
No. of red cards (hearts and diamonds) \(=26\)
Probability of drawing a spade or a red card=\(\frac{13+26}{52}\)
\(=\frac{39}{52}\)
\(=\frac{3}{4}\)

content.text: A card is drawn at random from a well shuffled deck of playing cards. What is the probability that the card drawn is a spade or a red card?
